snippet: A state scientist says that a department involved in a lawsuit over the effects of fracking on drinking water did not request full test results.
abstract: Pennsylvania scientist testifies that her laboratory had omitted data on some toxic metals found in water taken from private well near natural gas drilling site because state's oil and gas division had not requested full test results; deposition is included in lawsuit claiming that natural gas extraction through method of hydraulic fracturing has poisoned drinking water in southwestern Pennsylvania.

byline.contributor: John Schwartz contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: A state scientist says that a department involved in a lawsuit over the effects of fracking on drinking water did not request full test results.

headline.seo: Pennsylvania Omitted Poison Data in Water Report
headline.main: Pennsylvania Report Left Out Data on Poisons in Water Near Gas Site
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania Report Left Out Data on Poisons in Water Near Gas Site
